definition: inch (unit of length equal to 2.54 cm.)
propriety/appropriate behavior/proper speech or action/within the norms
land is extremely expensive (in that area) (idiom)
land is extremely expensive (in that area) (idiom)
square cun (Chinese unit of area: 1 cun × 1 cun, or 3⅓ cm × 3⅓ cm)/heart/mind
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
lit. not even a blade of grass grows (idiom)/fig. barren
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
to have a silver tongue/to have the gift of the gab
pinyin: san1 cun4 bu4 lan4 zhi1 she2

sentences.english: The soil sample came from a trench approximately 2 inches deep.
sentences.chinese: 土壤標本來自於一個大概2寸深的溝渠。

sentences.english: Sewasless steel tube is made in sizes for 1/8 to 24 inches.
sentences.chinese: 無縫鋼管制作的尺寸從八分之一寸到二十四寸。

sentences.english: Return your attention to the Eckasha still positioned 12" below your feet."
sentences.chinese: 將注意力轉移到位於腳下12寸的艾卡薩上。

sentences.english: Press mixture into bottom and 1 inch up sides of prepared pan.
sentences.chinese: 將混和物鋪在烤盤底部和四邊，每邊約1寸高。

sentences.english: Make stalks into match sticks about 3 inches in length.
sentences.chinese: 根莖去掉粗皮後切成3寸左右長段。

sentences.english: The east end, toward the sunrise, was also fifty cubits wide.
These windows are 9 inches thick. If they go, it's sayonara in two microseconds.
sentences.chinese: 窗的厚度是9寸，要是破裂，所有的人轉眼就沒命。

sentences.english: Grease a 6 or 7-inch Gugelhupf mould and dust lightly with a little of the flour, set aside.
sentences.chinese: 一個6或7寸的咕咕霍夫模具抹油灑上少許麪粉備用。

sentences.english: Inch is a measure of length.

sentences.chinese: 但這個該死的東西長20寸。

sentences.english: His father is 6ft 2in - I"d check the milkman."
sentences.chinese: 他的父親有6尺2寸，我要去查查那個送牛奶的。

sentences.english: Fujitsu’s 42-inch monster is as good a place to mark it as any.
sentences.chinese: 富士通42寸的怪物便是其絕佳代表。

sentences.english: Place the sponge cake in the bottom of a 7-inch mould.
sentences.chinese: 把海面蛋糕放到一個7寸的蛋糕模裏。

sentences.english: Seamless steel tube is made in sizes for 1/8 to 24 inches.
sentences.chinese: 無縫鋼管束作的尺寸從八分之一寸到二十四寸。

sentences.english: Make a note of your measurement and add 5 inches. That's your chest size.
sentences.chinese: 記錄下測量結果然後加上5寸，那就是你的胸圍了。

definition: a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]
to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
a (10 meter) square/a square of given side
chi (Chinese unit of length equal to ⅓ meter)
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
